derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cnēowlian, from cnēow (see knee)

entry.def: When you kneel, you bend your legs so that your knees are touching the ground.

example.ex: She knelt by the bed and prayed...
Other people were kneeling, but she just sat.
example.tran: 其他人跪着，而她只是坐着。

means.word_mean: 1. rest one's weight on one's knees;

sentences.sentence: "In church you have to kneel during parts of the service"
